bibl.title: The Evolving Shape of the Papyrus Collection in Geneva.

series.title: American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition

bibl.note: Outlines the most important links between the Geneva papyrus collection and other collections in the world. - The holdings of the papyrus collection at Geneva library. - Fitting the pieces together. Edition of P. Gen. Inv. 399, which is the lower half of P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 31497 (= S.B. VI, 9283). Contract of loan. Arsino誰ton Polis (Ptolema誰s Euergetis), May 11, AD 556. [A full publication of the contract will be produced under the heading P. Gen. IV, 194.]

bibl.title: Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007

bibl.idno: P. Gen. Inv. 399 + P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 31497

bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Gen. Inv. 399 + P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 31497
SCHUBERT Paul, The Evolving Shape of the Papyrus Collection in Geneva.

Traianos GAGOS (Editor), Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007 = American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition (Ann Arbor, 2010) pp. 713-716.

Outlines the most important links between the Geneva papyrus collection and other collections in the world. - The holdings of the papyrus collection at Geneva library. - Fitting the pieces together. Edition of P. Gen. Inv. 399, which is the lower half of P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 31497 (= S.B. VI, 9283). Contract of loan. Arsino誰ton Polis (Ptolema誰s Euergetis), May 11, AD 556. [A full publication of the contract will be produced under the heading P. Gen. IV, 194.]
